rules_in_order: Only consider features whose depends_on entries are all complete
Prefer features that unblock the most remaining incomplete features
Prefer security, access-control, and data-integrity work over convenience work
Use file order as the final tie-breaker

features.name: Center organization creation dialog
features.description: Move organization creation from sideboard placement to a centered modal experience.
features.why_it_matters: Creating an organization is a primary flow and should appear in a focused, expected dialog position.
requirements: Open organization creation in a centered modal on desktop
Keep mobile behavior usable (full-screen modal/sheet is acceptable)
Preserve existing create-organization validation and submit behavior
steps: Replace sideboard/sheet mounting point with shared modal container in the org creation flow
Ensure focus trap, escape close, and submit states still work
Verify trigger entry points continue opening the create dialog
acceptance_criteria: Organization create dialog appears centered on desktop
Form submission and error handling match previous behavior
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views

features.name: Add organization creation dialog placement tests
features.description: Add frontend tests confirming the create organization flow renders as a centered modal and still submits.
features.why_it_matters: Dialog placement regressions are easy to reintroduce without explicit coverage.
requirements: Verify create dialog uses modal container instead of sideboard pattern
Verify create action can still submit successfully
Verify close/cancel behavior remains functional
steps: Add tests in organization settings/org switcher view spec files
Mock create API success and failure states
Assert modal visibility and submit payload behavior
acceptance_criteria: Tests fail if dialog reverts to sideboard placement
Happy-path create and close behaviors are covered
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views

features.name: Restructure SSO settings into configure flow
features.description: Replace static provider cards with a single configure entry point and provider list.
features.why_it_matters: SSO setup should match common admin workflows where providers are managed from one configuration flow.
requirements: Show one primary "Configure SSO" entry point in organization settings
List configured providers with status and edit actions
Expose an "Add SSO" action for adding another provider
steps: Refactor OrganizationSettings SSO section into a provider-management shell
Render configured-provider rows/cards with enabled state
Gate mutation controls to org admins
acceptance_criteria: SSO section no longer presents only two static configuration screens
Admins can start configuration from a single flow
Existing provider update behavior is preserved
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views/OrganizationSettings.spec.ts

features.name: Add provider picker and SSO config modal/page
features.description: Implement the configure SSO interaction where admin selects a provider and then configures it.
features.why_it_matters: Provider-first setup reduces confusion and supports adding multiple SSO providers over time.
requirements: Open a modal/page/expanded panel from Configure SSO
Prompt for provider selection before showing provider-specific fields
Support both add-new and edit-existing provider flows
steps: Build provider selection step in the SSO configure flow
Render provider-specific forms after selection
Submit payloads through existing SSO API helpers and refresh provider list
acceptance_criteria: Admin can choose provider at configuration time
Admin can add another provider from the same configure flow
Save and validation errors are shown clearly
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views/OrganizationSettings.spec.ts

features.name: Add tests for provider-driven SSO flow
features.description: Add frontend tests for configure SSO entry point, provider selection, and add-provider flows.
features.why_it_matters: The redesigned SSO UX introduces multi-step state that should be regression-tested.
requirements: Test configure entry point rendering
Test selecting provider and opening provider-specific form
Test adding another provider and handling API failures
steps: Extend OrganizationSettings SSO specs for new flow
Mock provider load/save endpoints for both success and error cases
Assert admin/non-admin behavior remains correct
acceptance_criteria: Provider selection and add-provider flows are covered
Tests verify failure states without broken UI state
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views/OrganizationSettings.spec.ts

features.name: Expose dashboard folder creation entry points
features.description: Make folder creation clearly available from dashboard screens where users manage folders.
features.why_it_matters: Folder support is incomplete if users cannot easily discover where to create folders.
requirements: Add visible "New folder" action in dashboards view for admin/editor
Provide empty-state CTA when no folders exist
Keep viewer experience read-only with no create control
steps: Add folder create trigger in dashboard toolbar/header
Wire trigger to folder create modal/form and refresh list on save
Show role-appropriate visibility for create controls
acceptance_criteria: Admin/editor can discover and open folder creation quickly
Viewer cannot access folder create control
New folder appears in the grouped dashboard list after creation
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views src/components

features.name: Add tests for folder creation discoverability
features.description: Add frontend coverage for visible folder-create entry points and role-based control visibility.
features.why_it_matters: The current issue is a UX discoverability gap that should be protected by tests.
requirements: Test admin/editor sees New folder controls
Test viewer does not see create controls
Test successful create refreshes dashboard folder grouping
steps: Extend dashboards view/component tests for folder create CTA
Mock folder API create/list responses
Assert list updates after successful create
acceptance_criteria: Folder creation entry point tests pass
Role-based visibility is covered for create controls
test_commands: cd frontend && npm run test -- src/views src/components
